revised_title: Temperature Variability in the British Isles: 1869-1883
tldr: This article examines the variability of temperature in the British Isles from 1869 to 1883, using data from seven observatories. The author compares the results with other stations worldwide, highlighting the relatively low variability in the British climate. The study also investigates the frequency of sudden temperature changes and their magnitudes, finding that sudden rises in temperature are more frequent and of greater amount than sudden falls.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Climate and Meteorology
